column4: Hey all. I cannot log into ubuntu, it says home directory is out of room. Help!
nope
just gutsy
hd not full
a bit
df -h will tell you which partition is full, one of your partitions _is_ full
are you familiar with the console?
you can use ctrl+alt+f1 to switch to a console and login
then make space. ctrl+alt+f7 will normally switch back to x
are you still there? I have a terminal window open
log in, run "df -h" it should tell you info about some partition that is full
well if /dev/hda1 and it contains your /home directory that's the drive you need to clean up
just delete some files you don't need for a start, get it working then worry about whether you need to expand it
look for any large downloads you don't need anymore, cache and temp files etc
you might find running "aptitude clean" will delete enough stuff (it gets rid of all those .deb files you use once and never need again)
(if you are still there) I tried to change into the directory (sda1) to remove some files manually. It says it's not a directory
it's right /dev/blah is a device you want the other thing (like just /)
you want the bit in the "mounted on" column
if you have run aptitude clean and df -h is now reporting some free space i would suggest just trying to log in again

a line like - /dev/sda2              10G  6.2G  3.9G  62% / - shows that my second partition mounted at / has 62% used space, make sense? if there is nothing else containing /home it will the root (or the one with a /) partition that contains home and you want to clean up
are you still there?
what's the current question?
awesome, good work :)
